title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to asciicast
text: outlines propose change asciicast. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to asciicast
text: Small typos grammatical errors documentation may edited directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. YES: edit roxygen comment .R file R/. : edit .Rd file man/.

title: Contributing to asciicast
text: make substantial pull request, always file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s problem. ’ve found bug, create associated issue illustrate bug minimal reprex.

title: Contributing to asciicast
text: recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look Travis AppVeyor build status making changes. README contain badges continuous integration services used package. New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s).

title: Contributing to asciicast
text: Please note asciicast project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with asciicast
text: Thanks using asciicast. filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible. Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site. Armed reprex, next step figure ask. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed. right place, need file issue, please review “File issues” paragraph tidyverse contributing guidelines. Thanks help!

title: asciicast example vignette
text: example vignette creating asciinema screen casts. include screencast document, need two steps. first initialize asciicast engine: , chunks want display asciinema player, use asciicast engine: produce following cast:
code: ```{r echo = FALSE, results = "hide", purl = FALSE} asciicast::init_knitr_engine() ``` ```{asciicast} # This will be an ascii cast # Let's evaluate some code head(mtcars) ``` ## > # This will be an ascii cast                                                   ## > # Let's evaluate some code                                                     ## > head(mtcars)                                                                   ##                    mpg cyl disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb             ## Mazda RX4         21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4             ## Mazda RX4 Wag     21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4             ## Datsun 710        22.8   4  108  93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1             ## Hornet 4 Drive    21.4   6  258 110 3.08 3.215 19.44  1  0    3    1             ## Hornet Sportabout 18.7   8  360 175 3.15 3.440 17.02  0  0    3    2             ## Valiant           18.1   6  225 105 2.76 3.460 20.22  1  0    3    1

title: asciicast example vignette
text: can include DCF header asciicast, set parameters, e.g. height widget.
code: ```{asciicast} #' Rows: 5  # No much here, so avoid a big widget 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 ``` ## > # Not much here, so avoid a big widget                                         ## > 1 + 2 + 3 + 4                                                                  ## [1] 10                                                                           ##                                                                                  ##

title: asciicast example vignette
text: Recording asciinema casts might take long, everything happens real time. can tell knitr cache results, long code chunk unchanged. E.g. previous chunk caching looks like :
code: ```{asciicast cache = TRUE} #' Rows: 5  # Not much here, so avoid a big widget 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 ```

what: Casting a script from a file
title: asciicast example vignette
text: possible read R code cast file, instead specifying code chunk. advantage easier use code R scripts purposes.
code: ```{asciicast code = readLines("../inst/examples/hello.R")} ``` ## > print("Hello world!")                                                          ## [1] "Hello world!"

title: asciicast example vignette
text: Sometimes asciinema player widget used, custom JavaScript code forbidden page. common example README () markdown files GitHub. acsiicast can also use animated SVG images instead asciinema player HTML widget. set asciicast_knitr_svg option TRUE, ASCIICAST_KNITR_SVG environment variable TRUE. (former takes precedence set.) can also use SVG files show still screenshots, state screen running R code.
code: options(asciicast_knitr_svg = TRUE) ```{asciicast} #' Rows: 3 cli::rule(center = "TITLE", line = "~-", line_col = "blue") ``` ## > cli::rule(center = "TITLE", line = "~-", line_col = "blue")                    ## ~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~ TITLE ~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~- ## ```{asciicast} #' Rows: 3 #' At: end #' Window: FALSE #' Padding: 10 #' Cursor: FALSE cli::rule(center = "TITLE", line = "~-", line_col = "blue") ``` ## > cli::rule(center = "TITLE", line = "~-", line_col = "blue")                      ## ~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~ TITLE ~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-   ##

title: asciicast example vignette
text: default asciicast code chunks show code, .e. echo kntr option set FALSE . can override locally code chunk, globally, supplying echo argument asciicast::init_knitr_engine(). show code SVG image. header shown:
code: ```{asciicast echo = TRUE} #' Rows: 5 #' At: end # This code will be shown head(mtcars, 3) ``` # This code will be shown head(mtcars, 3) ## > head(mtcars, 3)                                                                ##                mpg cyl disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb                 ## Mazda RX4     21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4                 ## Mazda RX4 Wag 21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4                 ## Datsun 710    22.8   4  108  93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1

title: asciicast example vignette
text: Use asciicastcpp11 knitr engine compile cpp11 functions asciicast subprocess: can use functions regular asciicast chunks:
code: ```{asciicastcpp11} double mean_cpp(doubles x) {   int n = x.size();   double total = 0;   for (double value : x) {      total += value;   }   return total / n; } ``` ```{asciicast} mean_cpp(1:10000*1.0) ``` ## > mean_cpp(1:10000*1.0)                                                          ## [1] 5000.5

code: @Manual{,   title = {asciicast: Create 'Ascii' Screen Casts from R Scripts},   author = {Gábor Csárdi and Romain Francois and Mario Nebl and Marcin Kulik},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 2.3.1.9000},   url = {https://asciicast.r-lib.org/}, }

what: Create Ascii Screen Casts from R Scripts
title: Create Ascii Screen Casts from R Scripts
text: Turn R scripts terminal screencasts asciicast takes R script turns asciinema cast. can simulate typing, records terminal output real time happens.

title: Create Ascii Screen Casts from R Scripts
text: Input R script, output v2 asciicast recording. Record terminal output real time, happens. Simulate typing commands, configurable, randomized speed. Alternatively, whole comment blocks expressions can just appear screen. Convert casts SVG images using svg-term. package comes svg-term bundle, external dependencies needed. Render single frame cast SVG image. Configurable delay beginning, end paragraphs. HTML widget, used Rmarkdown documents, e.g. vignettes. Read casts asciinema JSON files (version 2), https://asciinema.org directly. Special knitr engine create R markdown files ascii casts. See asciicast-demo vignette. Create ascii casts GitHub READMEs via animated SVG files. See example inst/examples README.Rmd source README file reading.

title: Create Ascii Screen Casts from R Scripts
text: asciicast works best UTF-8 locale. also works well output ASCII, non-ASCII output might cause problems (https://github.com/r-lib/asciicast/issues/36).

title: Create Ascii Screen Casts from R Scripts
text: can install released version asciicast CRAN:
code: install.packages("asciicast")

title: Create Ascii Screen Casts from R Scripts
text: See inst/examples directory examples.

title: Create Ascii Screen Casts from R Scripts
text: input script: result:
code: print("Hello world!")

title: Create Ascii Screen Casts from R Scripts
text: Input script uses asciicast :
code: #' Title: asciicast example recorded in asciicast #' Empty_wait: 3 #' End_wait: 20  # An example for using asciicast, recorded in asciicast itself!      #!  # First, save the R code you want to run, in a script file.          #! # The file can contain any code, including interactive code,         #! # as long as it is a syntactically valid R file.                     #!  # Second, perform the recording with the `record()` function.        #! # We are recording an example file now, that comes with the package. #!  src <- system.file("examples", "hello.R", package = "asciicast") cast <- asciicast::record(src)  # `cast` is an `asciicast` object, which has some metadata and the   #! # recording itself:                                                  #!  cast  # You can write `cast` to a JSON file that can be played by any      #! # asciinema player. Or you can write it to an SVG file that can      #! # be embedded into a web page, or a GitHub README.                   #!  svg <- tempfile(fileext = ".svg") asciicast::write_svg(cast, svg, window = TRUE)

title: Create Ascii Screen Casts from R Scripts
text: Input script errors:
code: #' End_wait: 20 # Demonstrate that errors are handled well  # Base R error library("not-this-really") traceback()  # callr errors are saved to `.Last.error`, including a stack trace library(cli) callr::r(function() library("another-failure")) .Last.error

title: Create Ascii Screen Casts from R Scripts
text: asciinema: https://asciinema.org/ original terminal session recorder: https://github.com/asciinema/asciinema svg-term: https://github.com/marionebl/svg-term, https://github.com/marionebl/svg-term-cli

title: Create Ascii Screen Casts from R Scripts
text: MIT @ RStudio

title: asciicast parameters — asciicast-package
text: can set asciicast parameters header recorded R script. header DCF format (see read.dcf()), lines prefixed #' comments.

title: asciicast parameters — asciicast-package
text: DCF header may specify arbitrary parameters. list parameters interpreted asciicast functions. Recording parameters: allow_errors: Whether cast errors properly. set TRUE, asciicast overwrites "error" option. change know . cols: Width terminal, number characters. empty_wait: long wait empty lines script file, seconds. end_wait: Delay end, seconds. env: Environment variables include case JSON file. Defaults list(TERM = "xterm-256color", SHELL = "/bin/zsh"). idle_time_limit: Time limit cast printing anything, seconds. default limit. record_env: Environment variables set R subprocess. rows: Height terminal, number characters. start_wait: Delay beginning, seconds. timeout: Idle timeout, seconds R subprocess running recording answer within limit, killed recording stops. Update slow running code, produces output runs. timestamp: Time stamp recording, defaults Sys.time(), included cast JSON file. title: Title cast, included cast JSON file. typing_speed: Average typing speed, per keypress, seconds. Asciinema player parameters: author: Author, displayed titlebar fullscreen mode. author_img_url: URL author's image, displayed titlebar fullscreen mode. author_url: URL author's homepage/profile. Author name (author ) linked URL. autoplay: Whether start playing cast automatically. cols: Width terminal, number characters. font_size: Size terminal font. Possible values: small, medium, big, css font-size value (e.g. 15px). idle_time_limit: Time limit cast printing anything, seconds. default limit. loop: Whether loop playback. poster_frame: frame use (seconds) preview picture. poster_text: Text use preview picture. Defaults title. rows: Height terminal, number characters. speed: Whether play slower faster. 1 normal speed. start_at: start playback , seconds. theme: Theme use, currently string, one "asciinema", "tango", "solarized-dark", "solarized-light", "monokai". first one default. title: Title cast. Parameters SVG files: : Timestamp single frame render, seconds. cols: Width terminal, number characters. cursor: Enable cursor rendering. end_at: Upper range timeline render seconds. padding: Distance text image bounds. padding_x: Distance text image bounds x axis. padding_y: Distance text image bounds y axis. rows: Height terminal, number characters. start_at: start playback , seconds. window: Render window decorations. theme: Theme use, currently string referring build-theme, named list theme properties, see default_theme(). built-themes "asciinema", "tango", "solarized-dark", "solarized-light", "seti", "monokai", "github-light", "github-dark", "pkgdown" ,"readme". "readme" special theme switches light dark mode automatically README.md files GitHub.

what: Start an asciicast background process — asciicast_start_process
title: Start an asciicast background process — asciicast_start_process
text: expert use, want run multiple recordings process.

title: Start an asciicast background process — asciicast_start_process
code: asciicast_start_process(   startup = NULL,   timeout = 10,   record_env = NULL,   interactive = TRUE,   locales = get_locales(),   options = NULL,   show_output = FALSE )

title: Start an asciicast background process — asciicast_start_process
text: startup Quoted language object run subprocess starting recording. timeout Idle timeout, seconds R subprocess running recording answer within limit, killed recording stops. record_env Environment variables set R subprocess. interactive Whether run R interactive mode. Note interactive mode R might ask terminal input. locales Locales set asciicast subprocess. Defaults current locales main R process. Specify named character vector override defaults. See also get_locales(). options Options set subprocess, named list. deparsed code, code setting executed subprocess. See asciicast_options() defaults. Supply named list override defaults set additionsl ones. Passing large /complicated options might work, might slow. show_output Whether show output subprocess real time.

title: Start an asciicast background process — asciicast_start_process
text: R process, processx::process object.

title: Start an asciicast background process — asciicast_start_process
code:
# Use the same R process to record multiple casts process <- asciicast_start_process() script1 <- "a <- runif(10)
" script2 <- "a
" cast1 <- record(textConnection(script1), process = process) cast2 <- record(textConnection(script2), process = process) cast1 #> <asciicast> #> <config> #>   "version": 2, #>   "command": "R -q", #>   "timestamp": 1745925860, #>   "env": { #>     "TERM": "xterm-256color", #>     "SHELL": "/bin/zsh" #>   }, #>   "height": 24, #>   "rows": 24, #>   "width": 80, #>   "cols": 80 #>  #> <frames> #> # A tibble: 24 × 3 #>      time type  data                 #>     <dbl> <chr> <chr>                #>  1 0      rlib  "type: prompt"       #>  2 0      o     "> "                 #>  3 0      i     "a <- runif(10)
" #>  4 0      rlib  "type: input"        #>  5 0.0290 o     "a"                  #>  6 0.0958 o     " "                  #>  7 0.151  o     "<"                  #>  8 0.184  o     "-"                  #>  9 0.209  o     " "                  #> 10 0.257  o     "r"                  #> # ℹ 14 more rows cast2 #> <asciicast> #> <config> #>   "version": 2, #>   "command": "R -q", #>   "timestamp": 1745925860, #>   "env": { #>     "TERM": "xterm-256color", #>     "SHELL": "/bin/zsh" #>   }, #>   "height": 24, #>   "rows": 24, #>   "width": 80, #>   "cols": 80 #>  #> <frames> #> # A tibble: 39 × 3 #>      time type  data           #>     <dbl> <chr> <chr>          #>  1 0      rlib  "type: prompt" #>  2 0      o     "> "           #>  3 0      i     "a
"        #>  4 0      rlib  "type: input"  #>  5 0.0451 o     "a"            #>  6 0.0451 o     "
"         #>  7 0.0451 rlib  "busy: 1"      #>  8 0.0452 rlib  "type: stdout" #>  9 0.0452 o     " [1]"         #> 10 0.0452 rlib  "type: stdout" #> # ℹ 29 more rows

title: asciinema player HTML widget — asciinema_player
text: can use widget Rmd files Shiny applications, way HTML widgets.

title: asciinema player HTML widget — asciinema_player
code: asciinema_player(   cast,   start_at = 0,   rows = NULL,   cols = NULL,   autoplay = NULL,   loop = NULL,   speed = NULL,   title = NULL,   author = NULL,   author_url = NULL,   author_img_url = NULL,   poster_text = NULL,   poster_frame = NULL,   font_size = NULL,   theme = NULL,   idle_time_limit = NULL,   html_height = NULL,   html_width = NULL,   element_id = NULL )

title: asciinema player HTML widget — asciinema_player
text: cast asciicast object. start_at start playback , seconds. rows Number rows, defaults number rows recording, 24 specified cast. cols Number columns, defaults number columns recording, 80 specified cast. autoplay Whether start playing cast automatically. loop Whether loop playback. speed Whether play slower faster. 1 normal speed. title specified, overrides title recording. author Author, displayed titlebar fullscreen mode. author_url URL author's homepage/profile. Author name (author ) linked URL. author_img_url URL author's image, displayed titlebar fullscreen mode. poster_text NULL, used text poster (preview). poster_frame frame use preview. number means seconds. Defaults last frame. used poster_text NULL. font_size Size terminal font. Possible values: small, medium, big, css font-size value (e.g. 15px). theme Theme. idle_time_limit Time limit cast printing anything, seconds. default limit. html_height HTML height widget. html_width HTML width widget. element_id HTML id widget's element. NULL, id generated randomly.

title: asciinema player HTML widget — asciinema_player
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() cast <- read_cast(system.file("examples", "hello.cast", package = "asciicast")) asciinema_player(cast) }

code: default_theme()

title: The default asciicast theme — default_theme
text: named list.

title: The default asciicast theme — default_theme
code: cast <- read_cast(system.file("examples", "hello.cast", package = "asciicast")) svg_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".svg") mytheme <- modifyList(default_theme(), list(cursor = c(255, 0, 0))) write_svg(cast, svg_file, theme = mytheme)

title: testthat snapshot test with asciicast — expect_snapshot_r_process
text: ... Code run (unnamed arguments) arguments pass record_output() (named arguments). code evaluated new asciicast subprocess. output returned used testthat snapshot test. interactive Whether use interactive R process evaluate code. echo Whether echo code subprocess running . startup Expression evaluate subprocess recording snapshot. default loads attaches calling package, including internal functions. transform Passed testthat::expect_snapshot(). variant Passed testthat::expect_snapshot().

title: testthat snapshot test with asciicast — expect_snapshot_r_process
text: Code part snapshot always , Output part shows code, assuming echo = TRUE (default).

title: Initialize the asciicast knitr engine — init_knitr_engine
text: echo Whether print code asciicast chunks. same_process Whether run asciicast chunks R process. restart R process, call init_knitr_engine() . timeout Idle timeout, seconds R subprocess running recording answer within limit, killed recording stops. startup Quoted language object run subprocess starting recording. record_env Environment variables set R subprocess. echo_input Whether echo input asciicast recording. interactive Whether run R interactive mode. Note interactive mode R might ask terminal input.

title: Initialize the asciicast knitr engine — init_knitr_engine
text: purl() setting purl = TRUE chunk option, work properly, knitr thinks asciicast chunks R code, appear comments. know fix , please contact us.

title: Initialize the asciicast knitr engine — init_knitr_engine
text: Call function Rmd chunk can use asciicast knitr engine:
code: ```{r setup, include = FALSE} asciicast::init_knitr_engine() ``` ```{asciicast, cache = TRUE}` #' Rows: 10 # This is an asciicast example loadedNamespaces() ```

title: Install PhantomJS — install_phantomjs
text: version version number PhantomJS. baseURL base URL location PhantomJS binaries download. default download site unavailable, may specify alternative mirror, "https://bitbucket.org/ariya/phantomjs/downloads/". quiet TRUE suppress status messages progress bar.

title: Install PhantomJS — install_phantomjs
text: NULL (executable written system directory).

title: Install PhantomJS — install_phantomjs
text: function designed primarily help Windows users since cumbersome modify PATH variable. Mac OS X users may install PhantomJS via Homebrew. download package PhantomJS website instead, please make sure executable can found via PATH variable. Windows, directory specified environment variable APPDATA used store phantomjs.exe. OS X, directory ~/Library/Application Support used. platforms (Linux), directory ~/bin used. directories writable, directory PhantomJS installation directory asciicast package tried. directory still fails, install PhantomJS .

what: Extract / create complete screen frames from an ascii cast — load_frames

title: Extract / create complete screen frames from an ascii cast — load_frames
code: load_frames(cast, height = NA, width = NA)

title: Extract / create complete screen frames from an ascii cast — load_frames
text: cast aciicast object height Number rows. (NA default.) width Number columns. (NA default.)

title: Extract / create complete screen frames from an ascii cast — load_frames

what: Merge multiple ASCII casts into one — clear_screen
title: Merge multiple ASCII casts into one — clear_screen
text: new cast inherit options (screen size, etc.) first cast argument list. options rest casts ignored.

title: Merge multiple ASCII casts into one — clear_screen
code: clear_screen()  pause(secs)  merge_casts(...)

title: Merge multiple ASCII casts into one — clear_screen
text: secs Number seconds wait. ... Ascii casts merge merge commands. Merge commands provide way insert pause, clear screen, etc., casts.

title: Merge multiple ASCII casts into one — clear_screen
text: asciicast object.

title: Merge multiple ASCII casts into one — clear_screen
text: pause() inserts pause specified seconds casts. clear_screen() clears screen two casts.

title: Merge multiple ASCII casts into one — clear_screen
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # merge two casts, with a pause, and clear screen between them cast1 <- read_cast(system.file("examples", "hello.cast", package = "asciicast")) cast2 <- read_cast(system.file("examples", "dplyr.cast", package = "asciicast")) cast <- merge_casts(cast1, pause(3), clear_screen(), cast2) play(cast) }

title: Play asciinema cast as an SVG image in the default browser — play
code: play(cast, ...)

title: Play asciinema cast as an SVG image in the default browser — play

title: Play asciinema cast as an SVG image in the default browser — play

what: Import an asciicast from an asciicast JSON file — read_cast
title: Import an asciicast from an asciicast JSON file — read_cast
text: Import asciicast asciicast JSON file

title: Import an asciicast from an asciicast JSON file — read_cast
code: read_cast(json)

title: Import an asciicast from an asciicast JSON file — read_cast
text: json Path JSON asciicast file, version 2: https://github.com/asciinema/asciinema/blob/master/doc/asciicast-v2.md. numeric id, taken public https://asciinema.org recording id, downloaded. can also URL private https://asciinema.org link.

title: Import an asciicast from an asciicast JSON file — read_cast
text: asciicast object.

title: Import an asciicast from an asciicast JSON file — read_cast
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() c1 <- read_cast("https://asciinema.org/a/uHQwIVpiZvu0Ioio8KYx6Uwlj.cast?dl=1") play(c1)  c2 <- read_cast(258660) play(c2) } if (FALSE) { # interactive() c3 <- read_cast(system.file("examples", "hello.cast", package = "asciicast")) play(c3) }

title: Record an asciinema screencast — record
text: Record asciinema screencast

title: Record an asciinema screencast — record
code: record(   script,   typing_speed = NULL,   empty_wait = NULL,   cols = NULL,   rows = NULL,   title = NULL,   timestamp = NULL,   env = NULL,   idle_time_limit = NULL,   timeout = NULL,   start_wait = NULL,   end_wait = NULL,   record_env = NULL,   startup = NULL,   echo = TRUE,   speed = NULL,   process = NULL,   interactive = TRUE,   locales = get_locales(),   options = asciicast_options(),   incomplete_error = NULL,   show_output = FALSE )

title: Record an asciinema screencast — record
text: script Path R script record. can also readable R connection URL, passed base::readLines(). can also language object, deparsed, character vector source code . typing_speed Average typing speed, per keypress, seconds. empty_wait long wait empty lines script file, seconds. cols Width terminal, number characters. rows Height terminal, number characters. string "auto", determined automatically, including output screen. title Title cast, included cast JSON file. timestamp Time stamp recording, defaults Sys.time(), included cast JSON file. env Environment variables include case JSON file. Defaults list(TERM = "xterm-256color", SHELL = "/bin/zsh"). idle_time_limit Time limit cast printing anything, seconds. default limit. timeout Idle timeout, seconds R subprocess running recording answer within limit, killed recording stops. Update slow running code, produces output runs. start_wait Delay beginning, seconds. end_wait Delay end, seconds. record_env Environment variables set R subprocess. startup Quoted language object run subprocess starting recording. echo Whether echo input terminal. FALSE, output shown. speed Rescale speed recorded cast factor. delay first frame kept constant. process processx subprocess run cast . default new subprocess started. can reuse process calling asciicast_start_process() first, supplying returned process . interactive Whether run R interactive mode. argument ignored process specified. process NULL passed asciicast_start_process(). locales Locales set asciicast subprocess. Defaults current locales main R process. Specify named character vector override defaults. See also get_locales(). options Options set subprocess, named list. deparsed code, code setting executed subprocess. See asciicast_options() defaults. Supply named list override defaults set additionsl ones. Passing large /complicated options might work, might slow. incomplete_error Whether error incomplete expressions. might need set FALSE R code keyboard input, e.g. browser(). default TRUE. show_output Whether show output subprocess real time.

title: Record an asciinema screencast — record
text: asciicast object, write file write_json().

title: Record an asciinema screencast — record
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() script <- system.file("examples", "hello.R", package = "asciicast") cast <- record(script) play(cast) }

what: Record output of an R script and return it as a character vector — record_output
title: Record output of an R script and return it as a character vector — record_output
text: function uses record() internally, instead creating ascii cast, just returns output code character vector.

title: Record output of an R script and return it as a character vector — record_output
code: record_output(   script,   echo = FALSE,   prompt = echo,   stdout = TRUE,   stderr = TRUE,   ... )

title: Record output of an R script and return it as a character vector — record_output
text: script code record, passed record(). echo Whether include input return value. prompt Whether include R prompt return value. stdout Whether include standard output return value. stderr Whether include standard error return value. ... Addiitonal arguments passed record(). (use typing_speed echo, though, used internally record_output().

title: Record output of an R script and return it as a character vector — record_output
text: Character vector output (plus input echo, plus prompt prompt), appear terminal. See record() additional options.

what: Export ascii screencast to animated GIF file — write_gif
title: Export ascii screencast to animated GIF file — write_gif
text: Export ascii screencast animated GIF file

title: Export ascii screencast to animated GIF file — write_gif
code: write_gif(   cast,   path,   show = NULL,   cols = NULL,   rows = NULL,   theme = NULL,   scale = 2,   speed = 1,   max_colors = 256,   loop = 0,   end_wait = 10,   optimize = TRUE )

title: Export ascii screencast to animated GIF file — write_gif
text: cast asciicast object. path Path GIF file create. show Whether show GIF screen, viewer pane RStudio, using image viewer magick package. default show image RStudio. cols NULL, clip terminal width number columns. rows NULL, clip terminal height number rows. theme Theme. Currently supported themes: asciinema, tango, solarized-dark, solarized-light, monokai. Defaults theme specified cast, asciiname specified. scale Image scale / pixel density. speed Playback speed. Higher number means faster. max_colors Maximum number colors GIF. currently per frame. loop many times loop animation. Zero means infinite loop. end_wait Number seconds wait end, looping. optimize Whether try create smaller GIF files. might slow casts many frames.

title: Export ascii screencast to animated GIF file — write_gif
text: path, invisibly.

what: Create a HTML snapshot of an asciicast — write_html
title: Create a HTML snapshot of an asciicast — write_html
text: Create HTML snapshot asciicast

title: Create a HTML snapshot of an asciicast — write_html
code: write_html(   cast,   path,   at = "end",   omit_last_line = NULL,   prefix = "",   theme = NULL,   details = FALSE,   summary = "See output" )

title: Create a HTML snapshot of an asciicast — write_html
text: cast asciicast object. path Path HTML file create. take snapshot, defaults end cast ("end"). Can also number, seconds. omit_last_line Whether omit last line cast. often just prompt, sometimes worth showing. prefix Prefix add beginning every line. E.g. #>  usually added knitr output. theme theme name use, named list override default theme (see default_theme()). details Whether put output <details> tag. summary Summary <details> tag, ignored details FALSE.

what: Write an ascii cast to file — write_json
title: Write an ascii cast to file — write_json
text: file uses asciinema file format, version 2: https://github.com/asciinema/asciinema/blob/master/doc/asciicast-v2.md.

title: Write an ascii cast to file — write_json
code: write_json(cast, path)

title: Write an ascii cast to file — write_json
text: cast asciicast object. path Path write .

title: Write an ascii cast to file — write_json
code: script <- system.file("examples", "hello.R", package = "asciicast") cast <- record(script) json <- tempfile(fileext = ".json") write_json(cast, json)

what: Create animated SVG from an asciicast — write_svg
title: Create animated SVG from an asciicast — write_svg
text: Create animated SVG asciicast

title: Create animated SVG from an asciicast — write_svg
code: write_svg(   cast,   path,   window = NULL,   start_at = NULL,   end_at = NULL,   at = NULL,   cursor = NULL,   rows = NULL,   cols = NULL,   padding = NULL,   padding_x = NULL,   padding_y = NULL,   omit_last_line = NULL,   theme = NULL,   show = NULL )

title: Create animated SVG from an asciicast — write_svg
text: cast asciicast object. path Path SVG file create. window Render window decorations. start_at Lower range timeline render seconds. end_at Upper range timeline render seconds. Timestamp single frame render, seconds. Alternatively can "end", take snapshot end cast, output done. cursor Enable cursor rendering. rows Height lines. cols Width columns. padding Distance text image bounds. padding_x Distance text image bounds x axis. padding_y Distance text image bounds y axis. omit_last_line Whether omit last line cast. often just prompt, sometimes worth showing. theme named list override default theme (see default_theme()). show Whether show SVG file screen, viewer pane RStudio, web browser.

title: Create animated SVG from an asciicast — write_svg
code: cast <- read_cast(system.file("examples", "hello.cast", package = "asciicast")) svg_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".svg") write_svg(cast, svg_file)

title: asciicast 2.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2024-01-18 New show argument write_svg() show SVG screen. TRUE default RStudio. play() now show output viewer pane RStudio.

title: asciicast 2.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-12-05 record() new argument: show_output, show output subprocess real time. New SVG theme: readme, used README.Rmd (similar) files GitHub. generates two SVG files, one light one dark mode, creates README.md file automatically uses correct one viewed GitHub. New SVG theme: github-dark.

title: asciicast 2.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-11-21 New expect_snapshot_r_process() function run testthat snapshot test asciicast subprocess. Windows asciicast error patch version current R version different one asciiast built . happens often installing asciicast binaries, R versions fully compatible.

title: asciicast 2.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-10-26 write_html() now supports ANSI hyperlinks. Much better parameterization asciicast knitr. can now set asciicast parameters via chunk options. Relatedly, init_knitr_engine() options argument . Set knitr chunk options instead. See README.Rmd file package included github-readme.Rmd examples. HTML output now works better roxygen2/Rd. init_knitr_engine() interactive argument now, allow non-interactive mode. asciicast knitr now caches HTML output much better. asciicast now supports true color ANSI escapes HTML output (#46). asciicast_html_details option set, asciicast puts HTML output <details> tag. New interactive parameter init_knitr_engine() allows recording non-interactive R sessions. default (still) interactive = TRUE.

title: asciicast 2.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-07 new write_html() function can create themed HTML snapshot ascii cast. HTML otuput now default pkgdown, snapshots. animations still need use SVG files. asciicast can now record casts R installations R shared static library. SVG output now looks correct Firefox large fonts (#42).

title: asciicast 2.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-07-14 Completely new record() implementation uses embedded R interpreter subprocess. means asciicast can now record Windows, recordings much faster higher quiality. Another benefit simulated typing happen real time, recordings fast script , simulated typing (requested) added recording. also possible record R scripts valid R code. (fail course, sometimes ’s want show.) record() set error option asciicast subprocess , output errors simply recorded. New record_output() returns recorded output character vector instead asciic cast. Adding #' line omits simulated typing line line appear one step. New write_gif() function save cast GIF. needs phantom.js currently. SVG output can themes now. package comes bunch predefined themes, can create . See default_theme(). knitr options set temporarily now, restored knitr run. asciinema_player() HTML widget now properly sets height width player window, using height width parameters cast. record() now works script files end comment line (#13). initial R prompt now left recording cast. asciinema_player() now creates HTML widget works well Firefox well. asciicast properly tested now, much stable.

title: asciicast 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-12-13 First release CRAN.
